page.title: 11CLUBS AND SOCIETIES
page.content: There are many clubs and societies that meet regularly in South Godstone. The Sports Association, now eighty years old, has been a central focus for the community. Social and sporting occasions are usually well supported. An Evergreen Club for those aged sixty-plus, provide an opportunity for people to 'chat' with those of similar age. Women are able to join a Mother's Union, Women's Fellowship, and a Women's Institute, and along with their children, a Mother and Toddler Group, and a Playgroup. Children can select from; Cub Scouts, Venture Scouts, Brownies and Girl Guides, according to age. The R.S.P.C.A. Centre,opened in 1968,south of the village, covers an area of seven acres. The society deals with roughly 1300 dogs, 500 cats and 100 small animal cases per year.
